page.title: 10ARABLE FARMING
page.content: {ARABLE FARMING.} THE SOIL TYPES IN THE AREA ARE TYPICAL OF THE COTSWOLD COUNTRYSIDE WITH VARYING DEPTHS OF CLAY LOAM OVER FREE DRAINING ROCK.MANY FIELDS HAVE A HIGH PERCENTAGE OF STONE IN THE SURFACE SOIL.THERE IS USUALLY A LATE START TO SPRING GROWTH. GOOD GROWING CONDITIONS CONDITIONS LAST UNTIL EARLY JUNE. DURING HOT SUMMERS THE SOIL IS PRONE TO DROUGHT SO GRAZING AREAS ARE USUALLY SITED ON DEEPER SOILS TO REDUCE THE EFFECTS OF DROUGHT ON THE GRASSLAND. FARMS IN THE AREA GROW MAINLY WINTER WHEAT AND BARLEY.SOME OIL SEED RAPE IS GROWN.MOST BARLEY STRAW AND SOME WHEAT STRAW IS BALED FOR LIVESTOCK.STUBBLE IS OFTEN BURNT.THE ROYAL COLLEGE OF AGRICULTURE AT CIRENCESTER HAS FARMS ON SOME OF THE LAND AND EXPERIMENTAL PLOTS ARE SOWN.
